title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern and North-central Provinces and in Trincomalee district, according to the Meteorology Department.

title: At least 40 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza, medics say
byline: At least 40 Palestinians were killed by Israeli strikes across Gaza on Sunday, including two dozen when a residential building in the northern town of Jabalia was hit, Palestinian health officials and a human rights group said.

title: Health Ministry warns of fraudulent money collection scheme impersonating officials
byline: The Ministry of Health has issued an alert regarding a recent scam in which an organized group is reportedly collecting money from health staff and the general public, fraudulently using the names of senior ministry officials.

title: Vehicle crashes into Lake House in Colombo
byline: A car reportedly crashed into the front of the Lake House in Colombo early this morning (11), causing significant damage to the building’s safety fence.

title: General Election campaigning ends today
byline: The election campaigning activities for the 2024 General Election are scheduled to end at midnight today (Nov. 11).

title: Minister Herath visits BIA; discusses creating special unit for flight delays
byline: Minister Vijitha Herath visited Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Colombo to look into the complaints received with regards to the delays in Sri Lankan flights.

title: Gunmen kill 10 in bar shooting in Mexico’s Queretaro state
byline: Gunmen killed 10 people in a bar in the central Mexican state of Queretaro late Saturday, authorities said, adding to a wave of violent crime that is gripping several areas of the country.

title: Iran responds to claims of Iranian linked to Trump assassination attempt, Arugam Bay attack plot
byline: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi has responded to U.S. charges that Tehran was linked to an alleged plot to kill Donald Trump and tasked with targeting Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka while calling on for confidence-building between the two hostile countries.

title: First day of new Parliament on Nov. 21
byline: The Parliamentary Communications Department has issued a statement regarding the inaugural session of the tenth Parliament, to be commenced on November 21, following the 2024 General Election.

title: Ministry accuses mill owners of creating artificial rice shortage, vows prompt action
byline: The Ministry of Trade assures that there are sufficient stocks of ‘Nadu’ rice available within the country, as per the recent report prepared by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) pertaining to the national rice stocks.

title: Govt. will face another crisis in 2028 – Sajith Premadasa
byline: Leader of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Sajith Premadasa claims that the new government will also face the same consequences as the previous government by not being able to begin debt repayments in 2028.

title: Spike in fever among children: Officials warn of rising viral fevers and Dengue risk
byline: Dr. Deepal Perera, a paediatrician at the Lady Ridgeway Hospital for Children, states that a recent rise in fever cases among children is observed, attributing this to a surge in viral infections as well as an uptick in dengue cases.

title: Lohan Ratwatte’s bail request fixed for consideration
byline: The Court of Appeal has fixed for consideration a petition filed by former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte requesting him to be released on bail, on November 19.

title: India’s luxury airline Vistara concludes operations
byline: Indian full-service carrier Vistara will operate its last flight on Monday, after nine years in existence.

title: General Election: Voter’s index finger to be marked instead of little finger
byline: The Election Commission has announced a key measure for the upcoming Parliamentary Election scheduled for November 14, 2024.

title: Couple killed in Ambalangoda shooting linked to drug networks; drug feud suspected
byline: Police suspect that the Ambalangoda shooting incident which claimed lives of a man and a woman on Sunday (10) is linked to ongoing drug-related disputes and tensions.

title: SC allows to present President’s stance on Deshabandu’s appointment as IGP
byline: The Supreme Court has fixed for hearing the Fundamental Rights (FR) petitions filed challenging the appointment of Deshabandu Tennakoon as the Inspector General of Police (IGP) on February 24, 2025.

title: Court orders to seize Sujeewa Senasinghe’s controversial vehicle
byline: The Fort Magistrate’s Court has ordered the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) to take former MP Sujeewa Senasinghe’s controversial vehicle into custody and produce it before the court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Japan’s parliament reelects struggling leader Ishiba as prime minister
byline: Japan’s parliament reelected Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba on Monday after his governing coalition suffered the worst election loss in more than a decade, forcing the struggling leader to form his second Cabinet in just over a month since taking office.

title: Valuables worth Rs. 70M robbed from gem businessman’s house in Laggala
byline: Five masked robbers reportedly broke into the residence of a wealthy gem businessman in the Devaladeniya area, Laggala, making off with cash, gold, and gemstones worth approximately Rs. 70 million.

title: CSE to close early for parliamentary election
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange announced that the market will be closed at 12:30 p.m. on Thursday (14), in view of the 2024 Parliamentary Election.

title: 2024 General Election: What to do if you have not received polling card?
byline: The Deputy Postmaster General (Operations), Rajitha K. Ranasinghe announced that the distribution of official polling cards for the 2024 General Election has been completed.

title: Sri Lankan workers in UAE trafficked to Myanmar cybercrime camps, authorities warn
byline: The National Anti-Human Trafficking Task Force (NAHTTF) has issued a warning regarding a spike in cases of Sri Lankans being referred to cybercrime camps in Myanmar.

title: Parliamentary Election-related complaints exceed 2,800
byline: The number of complaints received by the Election Commission in relation to the upcoming 2024 Parliamentary Poll has further increased.

title: Probe launched into Channel 4’s Easter attack allegations: CID summons Pilleyan for inquiry
byline: Former Chief Minister of the Eastern Province Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan alias Pilleyan has been summoned to the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) tomorrow (12), in order to record a statement related to the allegations in the documentary aired by British television network ‘Channel 4’..

title: Kochchikade OIC arrested over election law violation
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Kochchikade Police Station has been arrested by the Colombo-North Crimes Division over an alleged incident of violating election laws, the police said.

title: Sri Lanka’s debt restructuring to be completed by year-end: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that Sri Lanka’s debt restructuring process can be completed by December.

title: Court orders to expedite tax probes on Piumi Hansamali and Aura Lanka chairman
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Bandara Ilangasinghe has ordered the Inland Revenue Department today (11) to expedite its investigations into actress Piumi Hansamali and Aura Lanka Chairman Viranjith Thambugala.

title: Dilith offers president a practical plan to solve Sri Lanka’s debt crisis
byline: Gampaha District parliamentary candidate and leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, Dilith Jayaweera, stated that he has a practical plan to address Sri Lanka’s ongoing debt crisis and is ready to assist the President in repaying the debt through this plan.
